mnemonics.visual: Imagine a tiny gorilla wearing a giant, sparkly earring. Every time you see that gorilla’s 'go-ring', you’ll remember '귀고리' means 'earring.'
mnemonics.notes: '고리' also sounds like 'go-ring'—like a ring for your ear.

mnemonics.visual: Picture a gorilla wearing a fancy, golden 'mock' necklace, strutting around like it’s the king of the jungle.
mnemonics.notes: '목' means 'neck,' and '걸이' is like the 'gear' you wear around your neck.

mnemonics.visual: Someone using a 'hoe' to 'saw' through paperwork, then 'won' the promotion to become the ultimate 'office worker.'
mnemonics.notes: '회사' means 'company,' and '원' means 'member' or 'employee.'

mnemonics.visual: Waking up, looking at your calendar, and saying, 'Oh, null! Everything’s due today!'
mnemonics.notes: '늘' can also mean 'always,' but here, think of it as 'now-ull'—as in, 'Oh, now it’s today!'

mnemonics.visual: Standing on a hill, singing at the top of your lungs because it’s your birthday.
mnemonics.notes: '생' means 'life' or 'birth,' and '일' means 'day.'

mnemonics.visual: Walking into a 'geo-sill' room where the teacher yells, 'Silence!'
mnemonics.notes: '교' relates to 'teaching,' and '실' can mean 'room.'

mnemonics.visual: Best friends huddling together, shouting 'Oo-ree!' like a team cheer.
mnemonics.notes: '우리' is for your close-knit crew.

mnemonics.visual: A group bowing politely, saying 'Jeo-hui!' to show respect.
mnemonics.notes: '저희' is for the polite, respectful group.

mnemonics.visual: Sitting at a table piled with food, and someone yells, 'Muck-da!' as you all dive in with spoons.
mnemonics.notes: Focus on '먹'—it’s all about that 'muck' (food) action!

mnemonics.visual: Your best friend covering you in 'cheen-goo' (glittery, sticky glue) because you’re stuck together forever.
mnemonics.notes: '친' means 'close' or 'intimate,' and '구' can mean 'help' or 'save.'

mnemonics.visual: In a noraebang (Korean karaoke room), belting out a 'note-ray' of pure song.
mnemonics.notes: '노래' is what you sing in a noraebang!

mnemonics.visual: Someone yelling 'Chum!' as they start dancing wildly, shaking everything—especially their bum.
mnemonics.notes: The word itself sounds like the rhythm of a fun, bouncy beat—'chum-chum-chum!'

mnemonics.visual: Someone 'chewing' on a party popper, shouting 'Ha!' as confetti explodes everywhere.
mnemonics.notes: '축하' is the noun for 'congratulations.'

mnemonics.visual: Bumping into a friend on the street and saying, 'Man, nah—let’s meet up!'
mnemonics.notes: '만' can also mean '10,000,' but here, think of it as 'many' opportunities to 'meet' new people!

mnemonics.visual: Someone at a party shouting, 'We’re jamming it—this is SO fun!'
mnemonics.notes: '재미' means 'fun,' and '있다' means 'to have.'

mnemonics.visual: A kangaroo hopping past you, saying 'Ha-roo!' as it points to the sunrise and sunset.
mnemonics.notes: '하' as 'ah' (a breath for a new day) and '루' as the 'rue' (street) you walk every day.

mnemonics.visual: A rat pack-style singer pointing at the ocean, saying 'Bada-bing!' as the waves swing in rhythm.
mnemonics.notes: Think of 'bada' as the sound of waves—'bah-dah, bah-dah.'

mnemonics.visual: Stepping on something sticky and saying, 'Duh-rup! Eww!' as you scrape it off your shoe.
mnemonics.notes: Focus on '더럽'—it’s all about that 'duh-rup' reaction!

mnemonics.visual: Lacing up your sneakers, standing tall, and saying, 'Got-da!' as you take your first confident step.
mnemonics.notes: 'Got' as 'go time'—so 'got-da' = 'time to walk'!

mnemonics.visual: Wandering the streets, 'seeking' out the best smells, and then shouting 'Dang!' when you find the perfect restaurant.
mnemonics.notes: '식' relates to 'food,' and '당' can remind you of the 'ding' of a bell when your order’s ready.

mnemonics.visual: Taking a bite of something so good, you blurt out, 'Ma-shit! This is delicious!'
mnemonics.notes: '맛' means 'taste' or 'flavor,' and '있다' means 'to have.'

mnemonics.visual: Sitting at a table, rubbing your belly, and saying, 'Um… sik! This food is amazing!'
mnemonics.notes: '식' relates to 'eating' or 'meals.'
